messages.subject: Kusunoki's 48 in Kyoto
messages.msgSnippet: Does anyone have a list of Kusunoki retainers ? Specifically the 48 men he placed in Kyoto ?         Thank you.
messages.messageBody:
Does anyone have a list of Kusunoki retainers ? Specifically the 48 men he placed in
Kyoto ?
 
 
    Thank you.
 
              
 




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Re: 47 ronin
messages.msgSnippet: Posting during my vacation in Tokyo, I was at Sengakuji Temple two days ago. This is my 3rd visit there. I m headed out to Osaka today. I ll be in Japan for
messages.messageBody:
Posting during my vacation in Tokyo, I was at Sengakuji Temple two days ago. This is my 3rd visit there. I'm headed out to Osaka today. I'll be in Japan for another 6 days.



Nina


-----Original Message-----
From: matt_donya_carter <matt_donya_carter@...>
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Fri, Aug 21, 2009 11:01 pm
Subject: [samuraihistory] Re: 47 ronin







Ken,

There's a plaque hanging in the Sengakuji Temple with all 47 Ronin's names on it, if you can read japanese or know someone who can translate it for you. :
http://jadkins.com/archive /sengakugi_temple_resting_place_of_the_47_ronin.html

Matt

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] 47 ronin
messages.msgSnippet: Tthanks again.  Actually, I have that book.  Looked at it last night.  As you say, only a few names mentioned. Ken   ________________________________ From:
messages.messageBody:
Tthanks again.  Actually, I have that book.  Looked at it last night.  As you say, only a few names mentioned.

Ken

 



________________________________
From: Robert McArthur <rmcarthur@...>
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, August 19, 2009 10:58:54 AM
Subject: RE: [samuraihistory] 47 ronin

 
The Allyn novel does not provide a list of the 47. Also, only a few of the
major participants are mentioned in the text.

Robert

_____

From: samuraihistory@ yahoogroups. com [mailto:samuraihistory@ yahoogroups. com]
On Behalf Of Rupert Collister
Sent: Wednesday, August 19, 2009 7:14 AM
To: samuraihistory@ yahoogroups. com
Subject: RE: [samuraihistory] 47 ronin

Hi

I believe there iss a full list in this book.

Allyn,
J.. (1970). The 47 Ronin story. North Clarendon,
Vermont: Tuttle Publishing: An Imprint of Periplus Editions (HK) Ltd.

Its 'faction', in that he took the known facts and added fiction in the form
of dialogue to make a novel but i think he has a list in the back, i don't
have it with me to check though.

Cheers R

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] 47 ronin
messages.msgSnippet: Most Japanese Historical sites about the event have pictures of the name board (at their grave site?) which list them...         As far as a list in
messages.messageBody:
Most Japanese Historical sites about the event have pictures of the name board (at their grave site?) which list them...
 
      As far as a list in Roman Letters (English)--- no idea. But, simply look up the event on Japanese sites and you will find that board eventually. Seriously.. time yourself.. it should take about 5 minutes tops.
 
 
 
 

--- On Tue, 8/18/09, Ken Hankerson <kenhankerson@...> wrote:
